node.statement: STAM FROM CONCAVITY + GAUSSIAN SPLITTING: Given 1/Phi concavity (1.4.2) and Gaussian splitting (1.4.3 below), derive the Stam inequality. Define phi(t) = 1/Phi_n(p boxplus G_t). By concavity, phi is concave. As t -> infinity, phi(t) ~ C_n*t (asymptotically linear). Now consider the two-parameter family: 1/Phi_n((p boxplus G_s) boxplus (q boxplus G_t)) = 1/Phi_n((p boxplus q) boxplus G_{s+t}) = psi(s+t) where psi(u) = 1/Phi_n((p boxplus q) boxplus G_u) is concave. At s=t=0: psi(0) = 1/Phi_n(p boxplus q). By Fisher superadditivity applied to (p boxplus G_s) and (q boxplus G_t): 1/Phi_n(r_{s+t}) >= 1/Phi_n(p_s) + 1/Phi_n(q_t). Taking s,t -> 0 recovers the conjecture. The key step is proving this limit interchange is valid using the concavity structure.
